TopicTitle: BobCat Ind. - Colonization, exploring and research vehicle

Articles.Content: Could you make the Lander platform smaller in diameter by loading the DEMV into it pointing nose up and having some kind of robotic hinge joint that lowers it to normal position after landing?

It is necessary to test the robot arm, but I do not think it will work well. Now I am considering various options, and many hours of test them using different modes. I think that first I will release the rover "as is" because the creation and development of the lander takes time. In any case, the rover is now almost ready for use, and good descent in stock parts.

Yay!

I have to ask though: Is the crew module full of Kerbals on launch? Because if it is...an empty version would be nice. Mostly so that it can easily be a nice addition to a fledgling base somewhere, rather than showering the place in Kerbals. (Though if you say "bah, I don't wanna" that's fine; it should be a simple cfg edit and duplication of the part file.)

Of the landers, the former is reminiscent of the Bigtrak Cuttlefish, which works well. The skycrane would require less modelling - an optional detachable drogue parachute for deceleration prior to deploying the skycrane's rockets would be nice.
Looks pretty cool. How long does it take until you finish?

The first Idea would work, if it was some sort of "Drop Capsule"

Only thing is, it'd need to be angled inside the capsule so its nose upwards ( To keep from making it a massive capsule, which would mean you'd need some way of straightening it when you land so its belly down. Oh, and the wheel assembly would need to be able to retract/fold.

Only thing is, it'd need to be angled inside the capsule so its nose upwards ( To keep from making it a massive capsule, which would mean you'd need some way of straightening it when you land so its belly down. Oh, and the wheel assembly would need to be able to retract/fold.

Everywhere there are pros and cons, hampered by technical limitations. Therefore, we must choose a path that will not interfere with the technical features of the game.

How long does it take until you finish?

I do not call release date, it could be tomorrow, or next month.

Of the landers, the former is reminiscent of the Bigtrak Cuttlefish, which works well. The skycrane would require less modelling - an optional detachable drogue parachute for deceleration prior to deploying the skycrane's rockets would be nice.

Yes, the first option is similar to the Cuttlefish. It good work to descent rover
I want both! but I prefer the kind of cutterfish...

payload test

45 t peak load (not recomended) - speed 60 km/h (recomended 10)

27 t max load - speed 75-80 km/h (recomended 50)

12 t recomended load - speed 112 km/h (recomended 80)
Wow, that's one hell of a payload. I don't think that a robot arm should be a priority, though.

Wow, that's one hell of a payload. I don't think that a robot arm should be a priority, though.

I will not do such a robotic arm, simply because they do not know how, even if I strongly want.
